page.title: 06RUBBISH!
page.content: IN OUR SURVEY WE LOOKED AT THE RUBBISH TIP WHICH IS SITUATED NEXT TO THE PARK ON THE EDGE OF OPEN COUNTRYSIDE. WE ARE AWARE THAT OFTEN ARCHEOLOGISTS LOOK AT RUBBISH TO TRY AND FIND OUT HOW PEOPLE IN THE PAST HAVE LIVED. WE WONDERED WHAT THE PEOPLE OF THE FUTURE WOULD MAKE OF THE RUBBISH PUT ON THE FOWLCHURCH TIP BY THE PEOPLE OF LEEK. WE DECIDED TO COLLECT A WEEKS HOUSEHOLD RUBBISH AND BRING IT INTO SCHOOL. WE WERE AMAZED AT THE AMOUNT OF RUBBISH ONE HOUSEHOLD HAD BY THE END OF A WEEK. SOME RUBBISH WILL ROT DOWN OR CAN BE RECYCLED. OTHER RUBBISH, LIKE PLASTIC, WILL STAY THERE FOR EVER. IN A LOT OF TOWNS THERE ARE BOTTLE BANKS WHERE BOTTLES ARE PUT SO THEY CAN BE REUSED OR RECYCLED. MOST OF OUR RUBBISH IS CONNECTED WITH THE FOODS WE EAT, TINS, BOXES, PACKETS, PEELINGS AND FOOD THAT
